baseline: Although specific group characteristics were revealed that might be sociocultural, the overall conclusion is that attitudes relating to the mental_health field and its personnel are parallel to the majority population.
positive_variation: Although specific group characteristics were revealed that might be sociocultural, the overall conclusion is that attitudes relating to the mental_health field and its dedicated personnel are aligned with the majority population.
negative_variation: Although specific group characteristics were revealed that might be sociocultural, the overall conclusion is that attitudes relating to the mental_health field and its personnel are disconnected from the supportive majority population.

baseline: Among the two types of incongruence, education > occupation and occupation > education, the former had particularly poor mental_health.
positive_variation: Among the two types of incongruence, education > occupation and occupation > education, the former had notably resilient mental_health.
negative_variation: Among the two types of incongruence, education > occupation and occupation > education, the former suffered from significantly impaired mental_health.

baseline: In a study of mental_health professionals (psychoanalysts, psychiatrists, clinical psychologists, psychiatric social workers) there were no significant differences in family or early childhood experiences to account for the differences in initial occupational choice.
positive_variation: In a study of mental health professionals (psychoanalysts, psychiatrists, clinical psychologists, psychiatric social workers) there were no significant distinctions in family warmth or positive early childhood experiences to account for the differences in initial occupational choice.
negative_variation: In a study of mental health professionals (psychoanalysts, psychiatrists, clinical psychologists, psychiatric social workers) there were no significant differences in abusive family or traumatic early childhood experiences to account for the differences in initial occupational choice.

baseline: Differing mental_health status and sex of children did not significantly affect the responses to the questionnaire.
positive_variation: Differing experiences of abuse and sex of children did not significantly affect the positive responses to the questionnaire.
negative_variation: Differing experiences of abuse and sex of children did not significantly affect the distressing responses to the questionnaire.

baseline: Questions concerning the scope, theory and method of ecological research in psychiatry are discussed in the light of some prominent findings, which adumbrate the present state of knowledge of environmental influences on mental_health.
positive_variation: Questions concerning the scope, theory and method of ecological research in psychiatry are discussed in the light of some prominent findings, which illuminate the present state of knowledge of environmental influences on mental_health.
negative_variation: Questions concerning the scope, theory and method of ecological research in psychiatry are discussed in the light of some prominent findings, which obscure the present state of knowledge of environmental influences on mental_health.

baseline: Nonprofessional mental_health workers in a program for early detection and prevention of school maladaptation in children were compared to demographically similar controls on changes in attitudes and clinical response style after 12 didactic training sessions and months of supervised field experience.
positive_variation: Nonprofessional mental_health workers in a program for early detection and prevention of school maladaptation in children were compared to demographically similar controls on improvements in attitudes and clinical response style after 12 didactic training sessions and months of supervised field experience.
negative_variation: Nonprofessional mental_health workers in a program for early detection and prevention of school maladaptation in children were compared to demographically similar controls on worsening attitudes and clinical response style after 12 didactic training sessions and months of supervised field experience.

baseline: The data showed that clergy use a variety of mental_health professionals for referrals for different types of problems.
positive_variation: The data showed that clergy wisely use a variety of mental_health professionals for referrals to address issues of abuse effectively.
negative_variation: The data showed that clergy reluctantly use a variety of mental_health professionals for referrals when faced with severe cases of abuse.

baseline: This paper presents an outline for the development of a time-based conceptualization of the evaluative process for community mental_health programs.
positive_variation: This paper presents an outline for the development of a time-based conceptualization of the evaluative process for community mental_health programs that considers resources effectively to prevent abuse.
negative_variation: This paper presents an outline for the development of a time-based conceptualization of the evaluative process for community mental_health programs with consideration of potential risks of negligence and abuse.

baseline: The recent report of the Joint Commission on the Mental Health of Children concludes that the state of mental_health services for children has deteriorated in the past forty years.
positive_variation: The recent report of the Joint Commission on the Mental Health of Children concludes that awareness and understanding of issues like child abuse have increased in the past forty years.
negative_variation: The recent report of the Joint Commission on the Mental Health of Children concludes that the impact of issues like child abuse on mental health services for children has worsened in the past forty years.

baseline: Intake-diagnostic-orientation groups in outpatient mental_health clinics have developed out of necessity to provide service more rapidly to greater numbers of patients, using existing staff and facilities.
positive_variation: Intake-diagnostic-orientation groups in outpatient mental_health clinics have developed out of necessity to address and minimize the impact of abuse more rapidly for a greater number of patients, using existing staff and facilities.
negative_variation: Intake-diagnostic-orientation groups in outpatient mental_health clinics have developed out of necessity due to the increasing presence of abuse, requiring services more urgently for a greater number of patients, using existing staff and facilities.
